subclusters.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on irreversible growth arrest, SASP secretion causing chronic inflammation and fibrosis, and persistence of senescent cells driving aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP-driven pro-inflammatory environment affecting immune function and bone marrow niche, linking senescence to immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP factors secreted by senescent fibroblasts altering tissue microenvironment and promoting aging and cancer via inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights SASP-driven chronic inflammation and epigenetic regulation of senescence contributing to vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP and signaling pathways mediating senescence phenotypes and inflammation, with therapeutic targeting of SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP secretion causing inflammation and tissue dysfunction, with senolytic therapies targeting senescent cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP-driven disruption of tissue architecture and antagonistic pleiotropy of senescence in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP secretion, accumulation of senescent cells, and their role in chronic inflammation and tissue degeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP-induced bystander effects and accumulation of senescent cells causing chronic inflammation and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP's dual role in tumor suppression and promotion, chronic inflammation, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights SASP-driven organ dysfunction and inflammaging due to accumulation of senescent cells in tissues.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP-driven proinflammatory feedback loops and telomere shortening triggering senescence and inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP secretion, senescent cell anti-apoptotic pathways, and accumulation causing chronic inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP secretion, resistance to apoptosis, and accumulation of senescent cells driving cardiovascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP-driven immune dysfunction, senescent immune cells, and feedback loops promoting systemic aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP-driven chronic inflammation, balance of senescent cell generation and clearance, and therapeutic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights SASP secretion, molecular pathways activating senescence, and its role in chronic inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP secretion, dual roles of senescence, and senolytic interventions validating senescence as aging driver.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP-driven inflammaging, stem cell exhaustion in lung aging, and genetic/environmental interactions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Chronic Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP heterogeneity, transcriptional regulation of SASP, and its role in tissue inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p16Ink4a-Driven Cellular Senescence and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p16Ink4a accumulation as a marker and driver of senescence induced by chronic social stress and DNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Tumor Suppression Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p53 as central regulator balancing tumor suppression and senescence-induced aging via cell fate decisions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mesenchymal Stem Cell (MSC) Senescence and Mitochondrial Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence of MSCs, mitochondrial dysfunction, autophagy defects, and SASP promoting systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Cell Transition and Interaction (SACTAI) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cell-autonomous senescence, somatic-to-MSC transition, senescent MSC SASP secretion, and non-autonomous cell death.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) via p38 MAPK Activation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p38 MAPK pathway mediating stress-induced senescence distinct from replicative senescence, linking inflammation and premature aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Response (DDR) and ROS Positive Feedback Loop Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes feedback loop between DDR and mitochondrial ROS production sustaining senescence via p21 and p38 MAPK signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitotic Errors-Driven Senescence via Autophagy-Dependent Bub1b/BubR1 Degradation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitotic defects, SAC attenuation, oxidative stress, and autophagy-mediated degradation of Bub1b/BubR1 driving senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: G1/S-Phase Transition Deregulation Theory of Replicative Aging in Yeast
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of aging factors (Whi5, ERCs) causing G1/S cyclin repression, cell cycle delay, genomic instability, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy causing accumulation of cellular damage and functional decline contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: cGAS-STING Pathway-Driven Inflammaging and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cGAS-STING activation by cytosolic DNA from mitochondrial dysfunction causing chronic inflammation and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: TXNRD1-cGAS-STING Mediated Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on TXNRD1 interaction with cGAS in cytoplasmic chromatin fragments promoting SASP and inflammaging via innate immune activation.
